what: Korean Baseball Organization Cheerleaders interactive database.
title: Korean Baseball Organization Cheerleaders interactive database.
text: Dive dynamic world Korean Baseball cheerleaders open-source interactive app. Explore detailed profiles, vibrant photos, fascinating insights favorite KBO League cheerleaders. comprehensive platform brings together information need discover appreciate stars Korean Baseball cheerleading, offering rich immerse experience one convenient place!

title: Korean Baseball Organization Cheerleaders interactive database.
text: can install development version KBOCheerleaders GitHub :

title: Korean Baseball Organization Cheerleaders interactive database.
text: “Pikki Pikki” song, originally Olive Beat’s Lecon Studios, become viral sensation KBO (Korean Baseball Organization) League, particularly associated Kia Tigers, cheerleaders use celebrate taunt rival teams signature low-energy dance. trend sparked “Pikki Pikki Challenge” gained widespread attention across social media. Shiny app, however, goes beyond just Kia Tigers. covers KBO cheerleading teams, focusing analyzing social media presence across YouTube, Instagram, TikTok. aggregating visualizing likes, followers, subscribers, app identifies influential cheerleaders, offering fans engaging platform explore vibrant culture KBO cheerleading.

title: Korean Baseball Organization Cheerleaders interactive database.
text: project introduces open-source interactive web application designed explore world Korean Baseball Organization (KBO) cheerleaders. app consolidates profiles, photos, biographical details Namu Wiki team pages, providing users seamless experience discovering interacting favorite cheerleaders. Key features include interactive tables built reactable gt, well dynamic visualizations display follower statistics across teams individual leaderboards. Users can easily compare follower counts per cheerleader team, making app comprehensive engaging tool diving vibrant culture KBO cheerleading. project features interactive web application focused exploring showcasing Korean Baseball Organization (KBO) cheerleaders. app leverages modern web technologies create intuitive dynamic user experience combines data analysis rich multimedia content.

title: Korean Baseball Organization Cheerleaders interactive database.
text: Expandable Reactable Tables: “Team Overview” tab, users can view reactable table row represents team. Expanding row reveals detailed profiles individual cheerleaders, complete follower counts platform. cheerleader’s row also includes bar charts total followers platform-specific statistics. Clicking cheerleader’s photo within table returns users insights page, displaying individual stats.  Dynamic Team Cheerleader Selection: dropdown menu allowing users select KBO team. team selected, app automatically updates cheerleader roster switches “Insights” tab, team’s photo, logo, hat prominently displayed.  Interactive Insights Page: cheerleader selected, insights view transitions team-level individual cheerleader-level, highlighting photo, biographical details, social media statistics bslib-powered cards. app fetches data Namu Wiki official team pages, ensuring accurate content.  Seamless Navigation Across Tabs: “Stats” tab allows users explore aggregate metrics team. Clicking column, aggregate followers, redirect users back “Insights” tab, focusing selected team’s details.  Top Cheerleaders Leaderboards: “Top Cheerleaders” tab highlights leading five cheerleaders across platforms like YouTube, Instagram, TikTok. leaderboard features detailed cards include cheerleader’s team logo, picture, link Namu Wiki page, total subscribers, total views, views-per-subscriber ratio. {gt} tables interactive JavaScript elements allow rich exploration leaderboard data.  Comprehensive Social Media Analytics: app integrates data visualizations provide comparative analysis cheerleader popularity. Followers, likes, subscribers analyzed across different platforms, giving users multi-dimensional view cheerleaders’ digital influence. Robust Data Integration Analysis: app’s data processing pipeline utilizes {rvest} web scraping {httr2} API requests, ensuring cheerleader team data current. app also employs advanced techniques matching image URLs social media profiles, creating enriched user experience. User-Friendly Design Experience: Built {bslib}, app’s UI features responsive layouts, ensuring optimal display across devices. Cards layout elements dynamically adjusted based user interactions, delivering visually appealing experience. R Shiny app just data-driven tool gateway lively culture KBO cheerleading. consolidates photos, profiles, statistics hundreds web pages one cohesive platform. aggregating data multiple sources, including Namu Wiki team sites, app offers seamless experience fans curious users alike. Whether users dedicated followers specific team interested exploring cheerleading landscape across KBO League, app provides engaging comprehensive journey. Users can discover favorite cheerleaders, track social media influence, dive deep vibrant cheerleading culture defines KBO experience.

title: Cheerleader Details — cheer_data
text: "Extracted namuwiki cheerleader profile pages."

title: Cheerleader Details — cheer_data
text: dataset list element corresponds cheerleader. cheerleader contains: table tibble 12 rows 2 columns detailing personal attributes. columns : X1 character vector describing type attribute (e.g., "Birthday", "Birthplace"). X2 character vector providing value attribute. links character vector containing URLs cheerleader's social media profiles.

title: Cheerleader Details — cheer_data
code: data(cheer_data) # Display details for the first cheerleader cheer_data[[1]] #> $table #> # A tibble: 12 × 2 #>    X1          X2                                                                #>    <chr>       <chr>                                                             #>  1 Birthday    "1994 April 22 (30 Years Old)"                                    #>  2 Birthplace  "Incheon Metropolitan City Bupyeong-Gu"                           #>  3 Nationality "Korea Region Dependent"                                          #>  4 Body        "167.7cm, 45.8kg , 235mm, Type A"                                 #>  5 Family      "Parents, 2 Older Sistersdogs Cheongi, Kongi, Gungi"              #>  6 Nickname    "Sugi, Korea's Top"                                               #>  7 Agency      "Play With Us Spotainment"                                        #>  8 Education   "Incheon Bugae Elementary School - Girls' Middle School - Girls'… #>  9 Debut       "Year 2014 Bucheon Hana Exchange Cheerleader"                     #> 10 Career      "Bucheon Hana Exchange (2014~2015 / Wkbl) Goyang Orion Orions (2… #> 11 MBTI        "ESTP"                                                            #> 12 Link        "<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/hs0422\" target=\"_blank\"><… #>  #> $links #> [1] "https://www.facebook.com/hs0422"                          #> [2] "https://www.instagram.com/seo_hsss"                       #> [3] "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrzTDI-wev6gpi0zBzJkqQA" #> [4] "https://likey.me/seo_hsss"                                #>

what: Fetch and Parse Content from URLs — fetchHTML
title: Fetch and Parse Content from URLs — fetchHTML
text: function retrieves content one URLs using httr2 package. supports returning either parsed HTML documents raw HTML strings. function includes error handling failed requests, non-200 HTTP status codes, issues.

title: Fetch and Parse Content from URLs — fetchHTML
Fetch and Parse Content from URLs — fetchHTML
text: urls character vector containing one URLs. single URL provided string, converted vector internally. return_type character string specifying return type. Options "html" (default) return parsed HTML documents using httr2::resp_body_html() "string" return raw HTML strings using httr2::resp_body_string().

title: Fetch and Parse Content from URLs — fetchHTML
text: single URL provided, function returns requested content (HTML document raw HTML string). multiple URLs provided, function returns list requested content (NULL request fails).

title: Fetch and Parse Content from URLs — fetchHTML
text: function performs HTTP GET requests either parses HTML content returns string, depending return_type argument. error occurs (e.g., network issues, invalid URLs), HTTP status 400 , function handle error gracefully return NULL URL.

title: All cheerleader/team data with social media metrics — ultraCombo
text: data.frame 14 columns

title: Ultra Combo Cheerleader Metrics — ultra_combo
text: dataset containing metrics cheerleaders, including social media statistics team affiliations.

title: Ultra Combo Cheerleader Metrics — ultra_combo
text: tibble 138 rows 15 columns.

title: Ultra Combo Cheerleader Metrics — ultra_combo
text: "Collected social media profiles (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok)."

title: Ultra Combo Cheerleader Metrics — ultra_combo
text: dataset contains 138 rows 15 columns information cheerleaders' social media metrics team details. columns include: name character vector names cheerleaders. subs integer vector representing number subscribers followers. views integer vector number views. count integer vector indicating number items posts. cat character vector denoting platform (e.g., "youtube"). likes integer vector number likes, NA indicating missing data. instagram_followers integer vector Instagram followers, NA missing data. tiktok_followers integer vector TikTok followers, NA missing data. team character vector indicating team cheerleader belongs . link character vector containing HTML links cheerleader's profile. team_img character vector filenames team images. color character vector specifying team colors hexadecimal format. logo character vector containing HTML team logos. photo character vector containing HTML cheerleader photos. avg_views_per_video integer vector average number views per video, NA missing data.

title: Ultra Combo Cheerleader Metrics — ultra_combo
code: data(ultra_combo) head(ultra_combo) #> name subs views count cat likes instagram_followers #> 1 Hyunsuk Seo 125000 54855523 532 youtube NA NA #> 2 Park Ki-Ryang 56300 13206467 158 youtube NA NA #> 3 Ha Ji Won 3850 0 0 youtube NA NA #> 4 Nayeon Kim 10800 696181 89 youtube NA NA #> 5 Jeong Ga-Ye 202 594 1 youtube NA NA #> 6 Hannah Kim 77000 22776102 91 youtube NA NA #> tiktok_followers team #> 1 NA Doosan Bears #> 2 NA Doosan Bears #> 3 NA Hanwha Eagles #> 4 NA Hanwha Eagles #> 5 NA Kia Tigers #> 6 NA Kia Tigers #> link #> 1 Hyunsuk Seo #> 2 Park Ki-Ryang #> 3 Ha Ji Won #> 4 Nayeon Kim #> 5 Jeong Ga-Ye #> 6 Hannah Kim #> team_img color #> 1 Doosan Bears.png #131230 #> 2 Doosan Bears.png #131230 #> 3 Hanwha Eagles.png #ff6600 #> 4 Hanwha Eagles.png #ff6600 #> 5 Kia Tigers.png #EC0F32 #> 6 Kia Tigers.png #EC0F32 #> logo #> 1 #> 2 #> 3 #> 4 #> 5 #> 6 #> photo #> 1 #> 2 #> 3 #> 4 #> 5 #> 6 #> avg_views_per_video age #> 1 103111 30 #> 2 83585 33 #> 3 NA 22 #> 4 7822 25 #> 5 594 28 #> 6 250286 34
